title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #904: Triangles with High Degree Sum**

If G has n vertices and >n²/4 edges, does it contain a triangle with d(x)+d(y)+d(z) ≥ (3/2)n?

**Status: SOLVED** (Edwards, 1978)

A strengthening of Turán's theorem showing dense graphs have structured triangles.
mathContext: This connects extremal graph theory with degree sequence analysis. The n²/4 threshold is the Turán bound for triangle-free graphs.

title: Vertex Degree
content:
**vertexDegree:**

d(v) = number of edges incident to vertex v.

The degree measures how connected a vertex is within the graph.

title: Triangle
content:
**IsTriangle:**

Three distinct vertices x, y, z with all pairs adjacent:
G.Adj x y ∧ G.Adj y z ∧ G.Adj x z

The smallest complete subgraph, also called K₃.

title: Triangle Degree Sum
content:
**triangleDegreeSum:**

d(x) + d(y) + d(z) for triangle vertices.

Measures the total connectivity of the three triangle vertices.

title: Turán Threshold
content:
**turanThreshold:**

n²/4 edges = maximum for triangle-free graphs.

Any graph exceeding this must contain a triangle.

title: Dense Graph
content:
**IsDense:**

A graph with more than n²/4 edges.

These graphs are 'above the Turán threshold' and must contain triangles.

title: High Degree Sum
content:
**HasHighDegreeSum:**

d(x) + d(y) + d(z) ≥ (3/2)n

Equivalently: 2(d(x)+d(y)+d(z)) ≥ 3n.

This is the key condition the conjecture guarantees.

title: Bollobás-Erdős Conjecture
content:
**BollobasErdosConjecture:**

Every dense graph (>n²/4 edges) contains a triangle with degree sum ≥ (3/2)n.

This strengthens Turán: not just any triangle, but a 'good' one.

title: Edwards' Theorem (1978)
content:
**edwards_1978:**

The Bollobás-Erdős conjecture is TRUE.

Edwards proved this in 1978, settling the conjecture.

Published in Combinatorics (Proc. British Combinatorial Conf.).

title: Main Result
content:
**erdos_904:**

Dense graphs contain high-degree-sum triangles.

This is the answer to Erdős Problem #904.

title: Sharpness via Bipartite Graphs
content:
**complete_bipartite_sharpness:**

K_{n/2,n/2} has exactly n²/4 edges and NO triangles.

This shows the threshold n²/4 cannot be relaxed.

title: Optimal Constant
content:
**constant_is_tight:**

The factor 3/2 is best possible.

Cannot be improved to a larger constant.

title: Mantel's Theorem
content:
**mantel_theorem:**

Max edges in triangle-free graph = ⌊n²/4⌋.

This is the k=2 case of Turán's theorem (1941).

Mantel proved it in 1907 - one of the first extremal results.

title: State of Knowledge
content:
**erdos_904_summary:**

1. **Turán/Mantel:** >n²/4 edges → triangle exists
2. **Bollobás-Erdős:** Conjectured high-degree-sum triangle
3. **Edwards (1978):** Proved the conjecture

Both threshold and constant are optimal.
